news_header: A bus accident in Guatemala City resulted in at least 51 deaths after the vehicle fell off a bridge into a ravine.
news_original_title: Guatemala: Bus plunges into ravine, killing at least 50
news_text: A bus carrying over 70 people veered off a highway bridge in Guatemala City, plunging about 20 meters into a polluted ravine and killing at least 51 individuals. The victims included 36 men and 15 women, with 10 others rescued and taken to the hospital. The bus driver reportedly lost control and collided with smaller vehicles before the accident. An investigation is underway to determine if the bus was overloaded and to establish the cause of the crash. Guatemalan President Bernardo Arevalo has declared three days of national mourning.
